item.title: Ticket #365 (time problems and error messages in blogger-import.php when Blogger ...) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When I imported my blogger entries to wordpress, I got several messages saying that there was a duplicate entry. After that, the last_insert_id(); of the wp_posts table was greater than the number of entries saved, althoug there were not more posts than there were in blogger. Also, the posts that was writen on times between 12:00 and 12:59 AM are stored like 12:xx when should be 00:xx.

item.title: Ticket #364 (Approving comment via e-mail link generates 2 e-mails to author) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: If a comment is put in moderation, and the administrator clicks the "approve" link in the e-mail that is generated, WP will send out 2 "comment posted" e-mails to the author of the post.

item.title: Ticket #363 (Page links error) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When filter weblog items by category, (empl: /?cat=1) page links are not displayed, instead mysql error is shown: Database error: [Unknown column 'category_id' in 'where clause'] SELECT COUNT(ID) FROM wp_posts WHERE 1=1 AND (category_id = 1) AND post_date_gmt <= '2004-10-13 10:48:59' AND (post_status = "publish")

item.title: Ticket #362 (Users of the same level can edit each others' posts) updated
item.dc:creator: tin
item.description:
My apologies. This bug report is similar to #0000359.

-tin

item.title: Ticket #362 (Users of the same level can edit each others' posts) created
item.dc:creator: tin
item.description:
For example, if there are three authors that all have Level 2 status, each author can edit the other Level 2 authors' posts via the "Edit This" link and through the "Edit Post" link when viewing the "Manage Comments" page.

Any particular author should only be able to edit other authors' posts if his level is higher than them, right? He shouldn't be able to edit the posts of other authors who is at the same level as he.

item.title: Ticket #361 (Database error when viewing posts by Catagory) created
item.dc:creator: tin
item.description:
Using nightly build 10/12/2004:

Whenever you view your posts by Catagory, the following error message displays at the bottom of the page:

Database error: [Unknown column 'category_id' in 'where clause'] SELECT COUNT(ID) FROM wp_posts WHERE 1=1 AND (category_id = 6) AND post_date_gmt <= '2004-10-13 08:14:59' AND (post_status = "publish")

item.title: Ticket #240 (duplicate category names cause DB error even on different category levels) updated
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description:
this problem still exists as of current cvs

if categories with the same name *aren't* allowed at different levels, then this needs to be handled gracefully instead of the current error/die:

Database error: [Duplicate entry 'articles' for key 2] INSERT INTO wp_working_categories (cat_ID, cat_name, category_nicename, category_description, category_parent) VALUES ('0', 'articles', 'articles', , '3')

item.title: Ticket #360 (Inconsistent case naming in wp-admin/categories.php) created
item.dc:creator: nickromney
item.description:
The three cases in the switch statement are inconsistent in naming and capitalisation:

Line 42: case 'addcat': Line 62: case 'Delete': Line 88: case 'edit':

I suggest these should be 'addcat', 'deletecat', 'editcat' respectively, OR 'Add', 'Delete', 'Edit'.

item.title: Ticket #290 (post-slug not update) closed
item.dc:creator: matt

item.title: Ticket #359 (Can edit all posts with a comment on the same userlevel (even 1st)) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: As in v1.3-a4, even a newly registered user, being at level 1, can go in his Admin panel -> Manage -> Comments and edit or delete all posts belonging to users on his userlevel, through the link "Edit Post <posttitle>". To be exposed, a post needs to have at least one comment. Since a level-one-user is (correctly) not able to edit or delete any post in the Admin panel -> Manage -> Posts page, I think this confirms that it's a major bug to be fixed asap!

item.title: Changeset [1787]: Use == instead of =
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Use == instead of =

item.description: Added enclosure support.

item.title: Ticket #357 (Tagline field for account profiles) created
item.dc:creator: Adam_M
item.description:
I'm most of the way through the creation of a new "about" page for which I've used the text of the profile field for a short bio and called it from the about page. This process gave me an idea for an addition to the profile editor.

Many magazines include a short blurb about the author at the bottom of each article, e.g. "Tom Jones is a freelance writer living in New York. He blogs at www.tjblog.com, and is working on a book about the history of the shoelace industry." It would be nice for the profile editor to feature a tagline field which, if filled in, could be called from inside the loop for inclusion at the bottom of posts. Would be ideal for magazine-style sites. Could also be used for comment sigs.
